Like drinking peach juice, both in flavor and texture. Tasty but odd.
Still delish!
Surprisingly good for Hale's! Good bourbon notes with only a slightly weak mouthfeel.
Great bourbon influence. But the Porter body is a bit weak. Still well done, just not as good as a bourbon imperial stout.
Wow, good stuff from full sail. Again, good bourbon notes, solid flavor, good body.
Quite sweet. But good bitterness. Better than the normal bastard.
Just noting I had the 2014.
Just as good as always.
Reminds me a bit of a Guiness. But a bit better. Smooth, chocolatey, delicious.
Quite strong oak, cherry and apricot. And of course lots of alcohol, though it's difficult to tell...it's easy drinking and not bad...
Bright and green compared to older versions. Needs to mellow. Would love to try again next year.
Bourbon forward. Grape and tabacco notes. And some pepper. Good.
Bourbon forward. Stone fruit is noticeable. Slight black pepper on backend.  I like.
So smooth. Great bourbon, stone fruit and pepper flavors. So mellow and great.
Light and carmely with grape notes. Good stuff.

beer_name: I Love You With My Stout
comment: Dark, rich, great mouthfeel and good chocolate notes.
Reminds me of a baltic Porter. Some grape, berry noted with some chocolate on the backend.
Wow, quite smoky up front with lingering chocolate on backend. Not a lot of oak or Whisky...
Quite sweet without overbearing oak. Good aroma and smoothness. And nice hop balance/flavor.
Amazing! Great bourbon aroma and flavor with a solid malt backbone that reminds me of graham crackers. Truly great bourbon barrel stout.
The Belgian yeast mellows out a big, roasty, chocolatey stout. Great play.
The chocolate and rye was a great juxtaposition in a big velvety Porter.
Crisp, light and drinkable. Good example of style.
Boom Shaka Laka.
Sis boom ba. Two great beers in the same night. What a life.
On Randall with cacao & mint. Huge disservice to this beer. It makes an otherwise amazing beer too bitter and smoky.
On Randall with toffee caramels. Reminds me of RC cola. Kinda syrupy and just OK.
On Randall with toffee (I think). It's like drinking a liquid cow's tail candy. And it's friggen awesome.
On Randall with coffee and hazelnut. Superb Randall blend. The coffee and hazelnut formed an earthy breakfast coffee quality. Good stuff.
On Randall with allspice clove cinnamon citrus rind and ginger. Haven't had base beer but this is good, balanced Randall blend.
Roasty with some chocolate notes and much oakier than the 2013. Kinda "hot" too, but damn tasty overall b
Wow. Upfront much like a Brown Shugga as in piney and sweet. But way more bitter. Good IPA, just not the season...
Light body with nutty malt backbone. Reminds me a bit of a Double Brown.
Coffee is light in aroma and flavor. Doesn't necessarily add much to the base beer.
This may currently be the best beer in Seattle, esp if you like bourbon barrel imperial stouts. And I do.
The base beer is still the best but the coffee up front and cinnamon on the backend was well done. I like it.
Roasty with a slight hint of smoky. Good stout but tough for it to follow the b-bomb.
Good citrus and pine notes. Well balanced.
Quite malty with mild piney hop flavor and some bitterness too. Just OK.
Very malty. No hop aroma or flavor to speak of. Ugh.
I was a little disappointed with the relative lack of flavor. It was smooth and balanced for a tripel but nothing special.
Quite hot this year. Ethenol was evident. Good roast malt flavor though.

beer_name: Brewer's Reserve Bourbon Barrel Scotch Ale
comment: So crazy sweet. And so crazy delicious with lots of pit fruit notes. Yum.
Ugh, malty malt of a pale with no notable hops. Fairly cloying and blah.
Amazing, like last year. Graham crackers, oak, vanilla, imperial stout goodness.
Not as good as the 2013. The aroma isn't quite noticeable and the flavor is less comples/roasty. Not bad, but not great.
Mostly just a lot of sweet malt backbone with enough bitterness to balance. But not much hop aroma or flavor. Just OK.
Rum, cherry, ethenol notes when cold. Super sweet and licorice notes when it warms. Overall, really unique beer but not quite amazing....
Super unique. Smells like an IPA but tasted like a graham cracker, chocolate laden stout. Really well done.
The initial coffee & cocoa aroma/taste is good but fleeting as ethenol sharpens and sweetness becomes cloying.
Very solid Imp Stout with roasty malt and subtle coffee/cocoa.
Oddly better out of the bottle with chocolate and vanilla influence. The oak notes remind me of mellowed graham crackers.
Piney with a small bit of citrus. The bitterness is rather pronounced...not bad overall.
Crisp, light and juicy fruity. Good go.
Super chocolatey and very rich. Descent stout.
Light, crisp with good tartness and not too much acidity. Reminds me of RR Temptation but not as complex in flavor.
Like a Carmel flavored liquid tootsie roll. But less impressive.
Good IPL. The lager yeast helps keep it light, crisp so the dank hops don't turn it flat at the end.
Wow. Great aroma and amazing flavor. Sweet, stone fruit flavors. Could be tough for a whole glass...
Quite sweet with notable ethenol and some cherry notes.
This was phenomenal. Great acidity balanced with complex, layered fruit flavors.
Pear flavor. Couldn't detect the gin influence.
Light and refreshing. Watered down hop flavor, but not terrible...
Good citrus hop flavor. Balanced bitterneness. Not bad.
With enough limes, it's almost as good as a dos equies.
Solid IPA.
No Li continues to impress. Great coffee stout w/o overpowering the coffee.
Flavor comes through as it warms. More citrus, melon and pine flavors. Still, quite malt heavy.
Good malt backbone with enjoyable Carmel notes.
Ok, so this bottle may have been a little past its prime. It was way too malt heavy with notable yeast influence...meh.
There was a LOT going on in this beer...perhaps too much, though still solid. Roasty and spicey malt with a citrus/piney hop punch.
I think Tres Floyds makes the best line of Pales out there these days. Amazing balance and great citrus flavor. Thanks for sharing Dave!
I think last time I had this it had aged too long...this was a pretty good Brown with great oak notes.
One of the best Saisons I've had. A fruity and delicately spicy belgian yeast blended perfectly with the Citra hops. Light and delicious.
Holy ethenol, beerman. Lots of flavor fighting with the ethenol though I was surprised the acidic coffee notes paired well with the high ABV
Lemony, as advertised. It was kinda like a more layered, improved flavor version of a Dos Equis...well, one that could put you on your ass.
If this were marketed as a 4.4% ISA, it might get as high as a 3.5. But as a Pale, it teeters on a 2.5 for its lackluster flavor.
Cream soda beer. Super sweet and kinda interesting. Not sure I could do a full beer...
Silky smooth and chocolaty. Not bad.
Just another IPA.
Very solid ipa. Great aroma and flavor with the perfect malt balance. Well done driftwood.
Really solid ipa, good flavor and aroma.
Flavor is really good but it's a bit sickly syrupy, difficult to drink a full one.
Great stout. Really sweet with lots of roasty malt and slight ethenol punch to balance. Wouldn love to taste the barrel age version...
Great out of the bottle. Once warmed a bit, slight burnt caramel notes with layered complexity to balance sweetness, oak and ethenol.
My last of the season....So. Damn. Tasty.
Tastiest CDA I've had in a while. Hops flavor and bitterness comes through strong with great Roasty malt balance.
Deliciously dank. Everything you'd want in a drinkable IPA.
Um, kinda like a negro modelo. Nothing especial (for those who don't know, that's Mexican for "special").
Hit the nail on the head here. Layers of complexity with a bright Brett background, dry white wine like finish. Well done. Happy 3rd to PB!
Still super silky drinkable, complex and tasty. But a little too much smoked malt influence for my liking...
Prefer this over the 2015--little sweeter and less smokey. Still, same rating.
Tremendous layers of flavor, with complimentary grape sour taste. Great drink.
If this is what the angels normally get, no wonder they always take it. Tremendous layers of malt, cherries, and oak. Deliciously smooth.
Never should have had this after Angels Share. Can't compare. Why'd I dare? Cause it was there...
Crisp, sour Brett notes followed by belgian yeast and muted spices. Quite refreshing.
Great aroma.  Notable sweet belgian malt and hints of whiskey barrels. Tasty but not a lot of layers....
Meh, just a candi sweet belgian ale...nothing special in my opinion.
Amazing. The cherry is so well infused, complimentary to the sour and base beer...great stuff!
The tart is strong in this one, and more smokey than I remember. A smokey, grapey sour stout. Truly unique. And good.
Quite estery/buttery...and very dry from tannins on backend. Meh.
Lots of tangy layers to compliment the sweetbread. Surprisingly good though still quite sweet.
More like la crappe on this one. Just way too sweet without much flavor.
Lots of flavor. Very interesting. Most unique saison I've had.
Lots going on here and it's not bad, but not anything amazing either. Though it could be if aged in bourbon barrel...
Bourbon, oak aroma is amazing. Malt is a bit too syrupy sweet. But I'm splitting hairs. This is great!
Fantastic bourbon and oak influence. So well balanced and quite delicious.
Really digging Belgian Pales with Brett. This one was great, delicate and bright with subtle Belgian influence.
Last one of this season. So amazing I already can't wait till next year.
Very refreshing, tropical and melony Pale. I'd definitely drink again...
A generous "average" Stout. Noticeably roasty with a strong, malty sweet influence. Not overly flavorful.
This was phenomenal. Great balance with the flavor and wood. I'd like more of this.
Citrus, dank, great malt/hop balance.
Pretty disappointed this time around. Juice and beer, little flavor. Kinda weak.
Little too heavy on the Brett Lambicus horse funk for my taste....
Citrus up front with a surprising dank/spicy hop blast on the back end. Good balance. Good DIPA.
Wow. This was amazing. By far the best IPA option from Fremont. So smooth and delicately balanced. Difficult for a TIPA...
Better than last year's...more balance but great citrus/dank hoppiness.
Yep, a liquid chocolate mint cookie. Grasshopper beer? Really strong flavor, but good flavor.
Tasted like peaches and cream ice cream...so it has that going for it. Which is nice. I guess.
At first reminded me of Pliney. High praise. Piney, balanced, slightly floral.
Crisp, light--dangerous at 9.5%
Tropical, balanced, delicious, smooth
Piney, lightly dank, solid IPA
Malty, amber-ish IPA
Amber-ish IPA, quite malty
Quite acidic! Almost too much to be refreshing.
Fantastic! Sweet but balanced with great bitterness. Piney, spicey.
Enjoyed this recently. Spicy and somewhat dank. Good ISA.
Piney, dank, balanced.
Drinking the non-blended version after a year of aging. Def getting better with age. Bourbon, velvet smooth, bit nutty. Delicious.
Excellent IPA. Tropical, melony, piney, balanced. Good stuff!
